channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Black New Yorkers Move Out, N.Y.C. Politics May Be Reshaped
item.description: Housing affordability and quality-of-life concerns are pushing longtime Black New Yorkers out of the city, underscoring Democrats’ challenges with the...

item.title: From the pandemic to porn, here's how norms around sex are shifting for Gen Z
item.description: Journalist Carter Sherman says that members of Gen Z are having less sex than previous generations — due in part to the political and social climate. ...

item.title: What to know about Jeff Bezos' upcoming Venice wedding — and the protests against it

item.title: Report: Iran state media say attack has begun on U.S. bases in Qatar and Iraq
item.description: Iran's state-run agency Tasnim says Tehran has launched missile attacks on U.S. bases in Qatar and Iraq.

item.title: Vera Rubin Telescope Quickly Found 1,200 New Asteroids
item.description: The Vera C. Rubin Observatory is expected to find millions of unknown objects in our solar system, and perhaps even a mysterious Planet Nine.

item.title: U.K. to Ban Palestine Action Group as Terrorist Organization
item.description: The British government announced plans to proscribe Palestine Action after members broke into a military air base.

item.title: Home sales just posted their slowest May in 16 years

item.title: How Hugo Aguilar Ortiz Became Mexico’s Most Powerful Indigenous Lawyer
item.description: Hugo Aguilar Ortiz grew up in a remote Mixtec-speaking village. He is now one of the most powerful lawyers in Mexico.

item.title: Emmy nominations voting ends tonight. Here's what our critic hopes will make the cut
item.description: Emmy voters have until tonight to send in their picks for nominees. Here's what NPR TV critic Eric Deggans thinks they should be voting for.
